citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The current written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) does not include the bird species at this facility. Birds are now
regulated by the Animal Welfare Act as of 21August2023 and must be included in the written program. The Attending
Veterinarian already evaluates the birds at this facility, but the guidance provided for the licensee is not documented in the
PVC. Not having all covered animals at a facility included in the PVC can result in potential suboptimal veterinary care
and daily observations. The regulations state that each dealer and exhibitor shall employ an attending veterinarian under
formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal
arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the
dealer or exhibitor. Correct by 25September2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
A Bird Environmental Enrichment Plan (BEEP) was not available for review during this inspection. The BEEP is currently
under development but has not been finalized and signed by the Attending Veterinarian (AV). Not having the required
BEEP in place can result in inadequate environmental enhancement for the birds. The regulations state the following:
Dealers, exhibitors, and research facilities must develop, document, and follow a species-appropriate plan for
environment enhancement adequate to promote the psychological well-being of birds. The plan must be approved by the
attending veterinarian and must be in accordance with the regulations in this subpart and with currently accepted
professional standards as cited in appropriate professional journals or reference guides. This plan must be made
available to APHIS upon request. Correct by 25September2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
